text: Actions speak louder than words.
A stitch in time saves nine.
Better late than never.
Don’t bite the hand that feeds you.
A picture is worth a thousand words.
When in Rome; do as the Romans do.
The early bird catches the worm.
Practice makes perfect.
Don’t put all your eggs in one basket.
Every cloud has a silver lining.
Life is what you make it.
He who laughs last; laughs best.
It’s not the destination; but the journey that matters.
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
What goes around comes around.
You can’t please everyone.
Life is a rollercoaster—hold on tight.
Time heals all wounds.
Life isn’t about waiting for the storm to pass; it’s about learning to dance in the rain.
You reap what you sow.
Hard work never goes unrewarded.
No pain; no gain.
Many hands make light work.
Don’t count your chickens before they hatch.
You can’t make an omelet without breaking a few eggs.
Where there’s a will; there’s a way.
Rome wasn’t built in a day.
Slow and steady wins the race.
If you want something done right; do it yourself.
You can’t have your cake and eat it too.
Blood is thicker than water.
Birds of a feather flock together.
A friend in need is a friend indeed.
Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
Two heads are better than one.
Keep your friends close and your enemies closer.
Honesty is the best policy.
A house divided against itself cannot stand.
Don’t judge a book by its cover.
The grass is always greener on the other side.
A fool and his money are soon parted.
Knowledge is power.
Look before you leap.
A little knowledge is a dangerous thing.
Curiosity killed the cat.
Wisdom begins in wonder.
Experience is the best teacher.
You can’t teach an old dog new tricks.
The pen is mightier than the sword.
Don’t cry over spilled milk.
You can’t stop the waves; but you can learn to surf.
Make hay while the sun shines.
You reap what you sow.
A tree is known by its fruit.
Still waters run deep.
A rolling stone gathers no moss.
The apple doesn’t fall far from the tree.
There’s no smoke without fire.
You can lead a horse to water; but you can’t make it drink.
April showers bring May flowers.
Money doesn’t grow on trees.
Time is money.
A penny saved is a penny earned.
The best things in life are free.
Don’t spend money you don’t have.
He who buys what he doesn’t need steals from himself.
Money makes the world go round.
The rich man’s wealth is his strong city.
A fool and his money are soon parted.
It’s better to live rich than to die rich.
If you want to go fast; go alone. If you want to go far; go together.
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
Fall seven times; stand up eight.
A man who plants a tree he will never sit under understands the meaning of life.
Trust; but always verify.
After the game; the king and the pawn go into the same box.
Tomorrow is often the busiest day of the week.
Little by little; the bird makes its nest.
A good laugh and a long sleep are the two best cures for anything.
He who has health has hope; and he who has hope has everything.
Success is the sum of small efforts repeated daily.
Fortune favors the brave.
Fail to plan; plan to fail.
The harder you work; the luckier you get.
Opportunities don’t happen; you create them.
Don’t wait for the perfect moment; take the moment and make it perfect.
Success is a ladder you cannot climb with your hands in your pockets.
It’s not over until it’s over.
Winners never quit; and quitters never win.
Nothing ventured; nothing gained.
The early bird might get the worm; but the second mouse gets the cheese.
Don’t put the cart before the horse.
Even a broken clock is right twice a day.
You can’t have everything. Where would you put it?
A watched pot never boils.
Too many cooks spoil the broth.
If at first you don’t succeed; try again.
Barking dogs seldom bite.
Don’t throw the baby out with the bathwater.
The squeaky wheel gets the grease.
